dublin_core.description: An interactive network visualization showing the relationships between different types of investors (institutional, retail, activist, hedge funds, etc.) and their connections to public companies. Uses graph theory to illustrate information flow and influence pathways in capital markets.

educational.topic: Investor Types, Market Dynamics, and Stakeholder Networks
learning_objectives: Remember the major categories of investors in public markets
Understand how different investor types relate to companies and each other
Analyze the network structure to identify key influencers and relationship pathways
Evaluate which investor types should be prioritized for different IR objectives
prerequisites: Basic understanding of public companies and stock markets
Familiarity with the concept of shareholders
Awareness that different investors have different goals
assessment_opportunities: Can students identify and describe each investor type?
Can they explain relationship labels and connections?
Can they predict which investors care most about specific company events?
Can they design targeted IR communications for specific investor segments?

dependencies: vis-network standalone library from unpkg CDN
accessibility_features: High contrast color scheme for nodes
Text-based information panel for node details

controls.name: Filter Investor Types
controls.description: Toggle visibility of different investor categories
controls.purpose: Focus analysis on specific investor segments

controls.name: Reset View
controls.description: Reset network to default view and enable all filters

controls.name: Re-layout Network
controls.description: Recalculate network physics and node positions

controls.name: Click Node
controls.description: Click any node to see detailed description

controls.name: Drag Node
controls.description: Click and drag nodes to reposition

controls.name: Zoom & Pan
controls.description: Mouse wheel to zoom, drag background to pan

visualizations.description: Force-directed graph showing investor types as nodes and relationships as edges
Color-coded legend mapping colors to investor types
Dynamic panel displaying selected node details
visualizations.purpose: Provide educational context for each investor type

simulation_model.methodology: Graph theory with force-directed layout algorithm (Barnes-Hut simulation)

node_types.description: Central node representing the public company
Institutional investors (mutual funds, pension funds, insurance)

assumptions: Network represents typical large-cap public company
Node sizes approximate relative ownership percentages
Simplified to 10 major investor categories for clarity
limitations: Does not represent specific company ownership structure
Static snapshot (real networks change over time)
Omits intermediaries like proxy advisors and custodians
Does not model dynamic behaviors like trading or voting
Geographic and sector differences not represented

pedagogical_context.course_chapter: Chapter 3: Investor Types and Market Dynamics
pedagogical_context.instructional_strategy: Interactive exploration with scaffolded scenarios from simple to complex
pedagogical_context.cognitive_load: Medium - multiple entities but clear visual structure
learning_progression: Identify and learn about each investor type individually
Apply filtering to focus on specific scenarios
Evaluate strategic priorities based on network structure
common_misconceptions: All investors have the same goals (actually highly diverse objectives)
Investors only connect to the company (they influence each other)
Retail investors don't matter (growing influence through social media)
Passive investors are disengaged (actually vote on governance matters)
Analysts own stock in companies they cover (actually independent researchers)
